qas.question: How many NCAA Division I colleges does Oklahoma have?
How many colleges does Oklahoma have in the Big 12?
How many fans attend an average Oklahoma State University football game?
What is the rivalry between OSU and University of Oklahoma called?

context: Collegiate athletics are a popular draw in the state. The state has <a0_0>four<a0_0/> schools that compete at the highest level of college sports, NCAA Division I. The most prominent are the state's <a1_0>two<a1_0/> members of the Big 12 Conference, one of the so-called Power Five conferences of the top tier of college football, Division I FBS. The University of Oklahoma and Oklahoma State University average well <a2_0>over 50,000<a2_0/> fans attending their football games, and Oklahoma's football program ranked 12th in attendance among American colleges in 2010, with an average of 84,738 people attending its home games. The two universities meet several times each year in rivalry matches known as the <a3_0>Bedlam Series<a3_0/>, which are some of the greatest sporting draws to the state. Sports Illustrated magazine rates Oklahoma and Oklahoma State among the top colleges for athletics in the nation. Two private institutions in <a4_0>Tulsa<a4_0/>, the University of Tulsa and Oral Roberts University; are also Division I members. Tulsa competes in FBS football and other sports in the American Athletic Conference, while Oral Roberts, which does not sponsor football, is a member of The Summit League. In addition, 12 of the state's smaller colleges and universities compete in NCAA Division II as members of four different conferences, and eight other Oklahoma institutions participate in the NAIA, mostly within the Sooner Athletic Conference.
